intro: Klainedoxa lecomtei, commonly known as the Lecomte's klainedoxa, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in semi-arid to arid environments. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow and are clustered in dense inflorescences, making it a unique addition to botanical collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
